subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: A couple of questions from a newbie
msgSnippet: ... When they call each other by phone, can’t they understand one another? Of course they can. Perhaps with a few difficulties in the beginning (they speak
messageBody:
Le 18/04/13 07:23, John Cowan a écrit :
> When Henry from Cardiff, Princess Imogen of Britain, James from
> Melbourne, and Kayla from Indianapolis write <Deed, If, Win-win>,
> <Deed, Yo-yo, Ooze>, <Judge, Ooze>, and <Deed, Ooze> respectively, it
> will take them some work to figure out that all these spellings
> represent the word "dew".

When they call each other by phone, can’t they understand one another?

Of course they can. Perhaps with a few difficulties in the beginning
(they speak different dialects, words are often pronounced differently,
some words have different meanings…) but with a little practice they
become aware of those differences and they can understand others’ dialects.

Why couldn’t they read others’ dialects?

JF
